item.title: 加拿大养老金公司聘请 Gubbels 负责私募股权投资业务；Kim 将离职
item.description: 加拿大养老金计划投资委员会（Canada Pension Plan Investment Board）提拔凯特琳-古博尔斯（Caitlin Gubbels）领导其全球私募股权投资部，接替在该基金管理公司任职 17 年后即将离职的苏义-金（Suyi Kim）。【原文：Canada Pension Plan Investment Board promoted Caitlin Gubbels to lead its global private equity group, replacing Suyi Kim, who’s leaving the fund manager after 17 years.】

item.title: 通胀数据公布后，债券交易员削减对美联储降息的押注
item.description: 由于数据显示 7 月份美国通胀进一步下滑，债券投资者略微降低了对美联储降息的预期，从而加强了下个月降息四分之一点的理由。【原文：Bond investors pared back their expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts slightly as data showed US inflation ebbed further in July, reinforcing the case for a quarter-point reduction next month.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚为何结束长达半个世纪的货币控制
item.description: 在过去的半个世纪里，埃塞俄比亚严格控制其货币比尔的官方价值。这种情况在 7 月份发生了改变，无法控制的债务和不断减少的外汇储备迫使亚的斯亚贝巴政府放开了汇率制度。在埃及和尼日利亚采取类似举措之后，这一决定使非洲之角国家从国际货币基金组织获得了 34 亿美元，并从世界银行获得了 166 亿美元。它还打开了与【原文：For the past half-century, Ethiopia tightly controlled the official value of its currency, the birr. That changed in July, when unmanageable debts and dwindling foreign reserves forced the government in Addis Ababa to liberalize the exchange rate regime. The decision, which followed similar moves by Egypt and Nigeria, allowed the Horn of Africa nation to clinch $3.4 billion from the International Monetary Fund and a further $16.6 billion from the World Bank. It also opened the door to talks with】

item.title: 区块链开发商 Offchain 的新业务部门将专注于更广泛的应用
item.description: Arbitrum 区块链背后的软件开发商 Offchain Labs 正在成立一个新部门，该部门将致力于促进加密网络的主流应用。【原文：Offchain Labs, the software developer behind the Arbitrum blockchain, is launching a new unit that will focus on fostering mainstream adoption of crypto networks.】

item.title: 印尼引领新兴市场反弹，收益吸引力和增长吸引投资者
item.description: 印尼资产周三在新兴市场中涨幅最大，原因是美联储下月开始宽松政策的预期推动投资者增加对高套利和高增长前景国家的投资。【原文：Indonesian assets posted some of the biggest gains in emerging markets Wednesday as the expected start of Federal Reserve easing next month pushed investors to increase exposure to countries with high carry and growth prospects.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行有新方法排出过剩的里拉流动性
item.description: 土耳其中央银行将开始通过国家主要清算所购买里拉，从而扩大其减少流动性过剩和维持高借贷成本的途径。【原文：Turkey’s central bank will start buying liras through the nation’s main clearing house, expanding the ways it can reduce excess liquidity and maintain high borrowing costs.】

item.title: Badea 为南部非洲工业化提供更多资金
item.description: 阿拉伯非洲经济发展银行（Badea）总裁表示，该银行将向非洲大陆南部的国家提供数十亿美元的资金，以帮助促进一体化和工业化。【原文：The Arab Bank for Economic Development in Africa, or Badea, is making billions of dollars of funding available to nations in the south of the continent to help promote integration and industrialization, the lender’s president said.】

item.title: Samsonite 董事会批准在美国第二次上市的计划
item.description: 森美国际集团（Samsonite International SA）董事会已授权这家箱包生产商在美国进行两地上市，以提高流动性，使其股票更容易被全球投资者购买。【原文：The board of Samsonite International SA has authorized the luggage maker to pursue a dual listing in the US to improve liquidity and make its shares more accessible to investors globally.】

item.title: 瑞士政府推动提高增值税，为提高养老金提供资金
item.description: 瑞士政府表示，与提高工资缴款相比，它更倾向于提高本国的增值税，以便为最近决定的养老金增长提供资金。【原文：Switzerland’s government said it would favor increasing the country’s value-added tax over raising wage contributions to fund a recently decided increase in pensions.】

item.title: 黄金生产商 Perseus 参股几内亚矿业公司
item.description: 澳大利亚黄金生产商柏赛斯矿业有限公司（Perseus Mining Ltd.）继续推进收购，成为贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.）支持的一家公司的最大股东，该公司正在几内亚开发一个项目。【原文：Australian gold producer Perseus Mining Ltd. continued its acquisition push by becoming the largest shareholder in a BlackRock Inc.-backed firm that’s developing a project in Guinea.】

item.title: 巨灾债券发行量将突破 2023 年纪录
item.description: 巨灾债券的发行量有望超过 2023 年创下的纪录，因为气候变化、人口密度和通货膨胀等一系列因素推动了围绕自然灾害建立的市场的增长。【原文：Issuance of catastrophe bonds is on track to exceed the record set in 2023, as a cocktail of climate change, population density and inflation feeds growth in a market built around natural disasters.】

item.title: Polestar 开始在美国生产，以规避高昂的电动汽车关税
item.description: Polestar Automotive Holding UK Plc 已开始在美国生产 Polestar 3 运动型多功能车，以规避美国对中国制造的电动汽车征收的关税。【原文：Polestar Automotive Holding UK Plc has started production of its Polestar 3 sport utility vehicle in the US to sidestep the nation’s tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles.】

item.title: 石油市场前景愈发岌岌可危
item.description:
中国的需求量正在下降，而美国、圭亚那和巴西的供应量则继续增加。【原文：

Chinese demand is falling while supplies from the US, Guyana and Brazil continue to swell.

】

item.title: 欧洲央行发现银行对商业地产的估值存在缺陷
item.description: 欧元区最高金融监管机构警告说，银行在如何估价数百亿商业房地产贷款的抵押品方面普遍存在问题，这凸显了贷款人低估其在房地产崩盘中的脆弱性的可能性。【原文：The euro region’s top financial regulator has warned of widespread issues in how banks value the collateral underpinning tens of billions of commercial real estate loans, highlighting the potential for lenders to underestimate their vulnerability to a property crash.】

item.title: 美国 7 月份 CPI 报告分析
加拿大房市萧条，房地产教练与学生对立
item.description:
一类新的教育工作者承诺帮助小投资者利用房地产积累个人财富。现在，反弹正在酝酿之中。【原文：

A new class of educators promised to help small-time investors use property to build their personal wealth. Now, a backlash is brewing.

】

item.title: 因 Flutter 对意大利业务感兴趣，Playtech 股价大涨 19
item.description: Playtech Plc 的股价创下了近三年来的最大涨幅，此前这家欧洲游戏公司证实了它正在与 Flutter Entertainment Plc 就可能以约 20 亿英镑（26 亿美元）的价格出售其意大利子公司 Snaitech 进行独家谈判的报道。【原文：Playtech Plc’s shares jumped the most in almost three years after the European gaming company confirmed reports it was in exclusive talks with Flutter Entertainment Plc on the potential sale of its Italian unit, Snaitech, for about £2 billion ($2.6 billion).】

item.title: 英国住宅建筑商股票因抵押贷款利率乐观而延续涨势
item.description: 由于英国通胀的最新数据进一步燃起了人们对抵押贷款利率下降和新房需求增加的希望，英国住宅建筑商的股票继续回升。【原文：Shares of UK homebuilders extended their resurgence as the latest data on inflation in Britain fueled further hopes of declining mortgage rates and increased demand for new houses.】

item.title: 印度短期借贷成本降至 2022 年以来最低点
item.description: 印度的短期借贷成本降至近两年来的最低点，反映出银行系统流动性的增加，而此时要求央行政策转向的呼声正日益高涨。【原文：Short-term borrowing costs in India declined to the lowest in nearly two years, reflecting a buildup of liquidity in the banking system just as calls for central bank policy pivot mount.】

item.title: 利率下降，美国抵押贷款再融资激增，创 2020 年以来之最
item.description: 由于借贷成本持续走低，上周美国抵押贷款再融资激增，创下自大流行病初期以来的最大增幅。【原文：US mortgage refinancing surged last week by the most since the early days of the pandemic as borrowing costs continued to drift lower.】

item.title: 据说 Blackstone 接近达成从 Audax 收购 Chartis 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 正与私募股权投资公司 Audax Group 就收购医疗保健咨询公司 Chartis Group 进行深入谈判。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is in advanced talks to buy health-care consulting firm Chartis Group from private equity firm Audax Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 瑞典家电制造商伊莱克斯聘请菲尔林为新任首席执行官
item.description: 瑞典伊莱克斯公司（Electrolux AB）从 1 月 1 日起聘请亚尼克-菲尔林（Yannick Fierling）担任新的首席执行官，因为这家家用电器制造商仍在努力应对其许多市场的消费需求疲软。【原文：Sweden’s Electrolux AB hired Yannick Fierling as its new chief executive officer starting Jan. 1, as the household appliance maker continues to grapple with weak consumer demand across many of its markets.】

item.title: 加纳通胀降至 28 个月低点，为降息开辟道路
item.description: 加纳的年通胀率在 7 月份放缓至 28 个月以来的最低水平，为今年进一步放宽货币政策创造了空间。【原文：Ghana’s annual inflation slowed to 28-month low in July, creating space for further monetary policy easing this year.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。投资者在等待美国的 CPI，美元兑欧元跌至 1 月份以来的最低点，而英国的通胀给英格兰银行带来了提振。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题。【原文：Good morning. Investors await US CPI, the dollar weakens to the lowest since January against the euro and UK inflation gives the Bank of England a boost. Here’s what traders are talking about. — David Goodman】

item.title: 市场等待伊朗报复，石油期权活动跃升
item.description: 在市场为伊朗可能对以色列发动袭击做好准备之际，石油交易商们正重返期权合约，以规避价格飙升的风险。【原文：Oil traders are returning to options contracts to hedge against the risk of a price spike as markets brace for a possible Iranian attack on Israel.】

item.title: 印度天鹅公司将以 3.99 亿美元向 Botas 公司出售液化天然气码头
item.description: 印度天鹅能源有限公司计划以 3.99 亿美元的价格向土耳其国营 Botas 公司出售其在浮式液化天然气码头的股份。【原文：India’s Swan Energy Ltd. plans to sell its stake in a floating liquefied natural gas terminal to Turkey’s state-run Botas for $399 million.】

item.title: 依靠出口，荷兰经济以两年来最快速度增长
item.description: 荷兰第二季度经济增长超过预期，增速为两年来最快。【原文：The Dutch economy grew more than anticipated in the second quarter, expanding at the fastest pace in two years.】

item.title: 对冲基金争相将 ChatGPT 从实习生变为分析师
item.description: 克里斯-普尔曼（Chris Pulman）曾花两天时间准备央行会议的预告。现在，这位 Balyasny 资产管理公司的首席经济学家只需花上 30 分钟即可完成。【原文：Chris Pulman used to spend two days prepping previews for central bank meetings. Now it can take the chief economist at Balyasny Asset Management as little as 30 minutes.】

item.title: 伦敦房价一年多来首次年度上涨
item.description: 伦敦的房价在一年多的时间里首次出现上涨，这表明伦敦的房地产市场开始摆脱利率上调的影响。【原文：House prices in London rose for the first time in more than a year, a sign that its property market is beginning to shake off the impact of higher interest rates.】

item.title: 印度金属巨头 Hindalco 将于 2025 年尝试 Novelis IPO
item.description: 推迟了 Novelis 公司首次公开募股的 Hindalco Industries Ltd. 表示，正在为其美国子公司寻求溢价估值，任何上市尝试都将在 2025 年进行。【原文：Hindalco Industries Ltd., which delayed an initial public offering for Novelis Inc., said it’s seeking a premium valuation for its US unit and any attempt to list it will take place in 2025.】
